question_title: What are some snacks you can have while on the Atkins diet? Not any of that Atkins brand stuff, other stuff.? [SEP] question_content: My fiance is on the atkins diet and has been for two weeks today.  He is having some trouble only eating meat and cheese and is trying to find some other things he can eat that don't have any carbs.  We found that jello and whipped creme I believe it is, don't have any carbs so I made him a bunch of that but I am wondering what else is out there.

Are there any other food you know of that don't have any carbs or <1g of carbs?  

I know they have that Atkins brand food, but I know there has to be something out there, "regular food" that he could eat besides buying that expensive food.

After two weeks he is allowed to have 24g of carbs a day, but obviously less is better.

Thanks so much! [SEP] best_answer: it really pays to become acquainted with the rest of the diet.  Just meat and cheese is not required at any stage, but after week two you get a lot more flexibility.  As a guy I think he can go quite a bit higher during stage 2..check the book or website again.

great snacks, not all under 1 net carb (you need to understand carb from net carb because net carbs are the only ones that count..see the web links below)

deviled eggs
sliced ham with cream cheese spread on the inside and rolled up
pork rinds
I forget the name but there's a company out there that makes crackers out of cheese and they are good..check lowcarbluxury.com

nuts
strawberries
beef jerky
roasted soy nuts
sugar free jello 
carbsmart creamsicles (these are my favorite snack and they ARE 0 carbs!)
low carb ice cream
low carb yogurt (and I read a recent report that suggest the residual carbs in yogurt don't have to be counted because they are pre-digested)
pork rinds (can be dipped into any low carb dip or salsa)

It also pays to learn to cook as there are thousands of great recipes out there, even recipes for cookies and cakes!  Cooking is also the best way to control what's really in your food.

There are also good products that taste a lot better than the Atkins brand stuff.  Keto makes good stuff, and the Pure Delight Chocolates (Walmart had them, World Market still does) are better than most other chocolates.

The warnings - Some of the sweetners in sugar free and low carb sweets can have a laxative effect on some.  If you're sensitive to them, they will give you gas that will peel paint!

Also...adding snacks is good, but at no time on atkins are you supposed to eat yourself silly.  Even though all you are counting is carbs, he tells you to eat only until satisfied.  You can still overeat and sabotage the diet.  What's more the whole point is that you learn new habits, so snacking all the time is not a good idea.

question_title: What meals can i cook up to clear up my acne? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Refined carbs/sugar = more insulin = more hormones = more sebum (oil) = more bacteria = more acne

We're always being told that a diet of pizza and chocolate doesn't cause acne, which may be true to a certain extent, but certain foods can aggravate acne. Simply by cutting down on the foods that can aggravate acne and eating more foods that can help alleviate acne your skin condition will improve.

People with skin that is susceptible to acne can benefit from eating a wide range of fresh fruit, vegetables, nuts and seeds. These foods have been found to be beneficial in helping reduce acne.

For good skin health, you need plenty of antioxidants (vitamin A (mainly from beta-carotene), vitamins C and E and selenium), B vitamins, vitamin D, calcium, potassium, phosphorus, chloride, magnesium, zinc, iron and sodium. A diet high in beta-carotene and zinc can be especially beneficial to acne. Men with acne can also benefit from extra selenium. Having plenty of the right minerals and vitamins will also help your skin by speeding up the healing process and spots and scarring will fade more quickly. 

Drink at least 2 litres of still mineral water daily. Drinking plenty of water helps reduce acne by flushing toxins out of your system and keeping your kidneys, liver and bowel functioning effectively. A sluggish digestive system is often linked to acne. Drinking plenty of water and eating lots of fibre in the form of fruit and vegetables will keep your insides healthy. Water will also help keep your skin supple and hydrated. Dehydrated skin can become dry and flaky, the skin's natural exfoliation slows down and pores become blocked which in turn can cause spots.

question_title: How do I be more social? I am quite the hermit and this is really impacting me emotionally.? [SEP] question_content: How do I meet new people when I am very reserved?\nRecently all of my friends moved and now I have no one.I also have not had a boyfriend for almost 3 years. (I tell myself the reason for not having a boyfriend was because I was so busy going to school and work) \nMy friend came and visited me this weekend and told me I have to stop keeping myself in my shell and get out and meet people and that she is really worried for me. I am very reserved and have a hard time opening up to people..even my close friends. I am worried too!However I hate going out to bars. How can I meet new people from scratch? This is very hard for me. It's like I want to reach out to people however I feel it is easier to turn inward and become a hermit. I am very lonely and spend almost every waking alone. Help! I am only 27!!! [SEP] best_answer: To be more social on a regular basis, a person has to take themselves out of their shell. You probably like it in your shell because that's where you're comfortable, You've been there so long and it's nice and cozy. What is not often realized is that when you do something that's outside of your comfort zone enough times, it becomes your new comfort zone! Adaptation.. Improvisation.. but your weakness is not your technique. Go out on a regular basis and make a note of it to just say hi to people. Then when the situation arises and you think you'll live through it, Talk to people when waiting in the checkout line or in any type of waiting situation. Talk about anything, weather, something they're wearing, something you like about them. Keep it positive! After a while of this you'll eventually realize, wow, I'm so much more outgoing than I used to be. And it will be good.

question_title: I need weight loss help!!!!!!? [SEP] question_content: I am 26 years old and have had five children in nine years. I am currently my heaviest I have ever been. I weigh 225 lbs. My twin boys are going to be 1 year old next month. My husband hasn't touched me in almost three months. I stay at home and I have a YMCA membership, but I don't know what to do for my size.  I need serious answers here. [SEP] best_answer: 3 years ago I weighed 230 so I totally understand what you are going through. The hardest thing is you cant actually lose weight until you are truly happy with yourself.
I did the Subway diet for the first year. I would have 1 foot-long everyday with a small breakfast and snack. I would eat a 6inch for lunch and dinner. You can have any of the under 6grams of fat sandwiches with no mayo. (They're all delicious my favorite is Sweet Onion Chicken Teriyaki) 
Breakfast ideas are oatmeal or oatmeal with one piece of whole wheat bread. Whole grain cereal, An egg on a piece of whole wheat toast and some salsa. Also for a snack or lunch you Can have Lean Cuisines (which are actually delicious) and of course vegetables and fruit are always a great snack. I really like sliced up apples with a lil bit of peanut butter on top. 
There is alot of different things you can have. You want to make sure you eat 6 small portions a day, even if you arn't hungry still eat small portions so you don't accidentally over eat. 
I personally count calories. The average women can have 2,000 calories a day so if you start eating 1,700 calories instead you will lose about 2 lbs. a week. Also you should walk for at least 30 minutes a day. 
It also helps to have a friend to talk with about your weight struggles because it is so hard. 
Feel free to contact me back. =o)

question_title: sun allergy? [SEP] question_content: in the summer i get these awful bumps on my face, this only happens at summer any other time my face is fine. Does anyone else suffer this and know of a good cream. No matter how high the factor is on my sun block they still manage to show up every year, and take monthe to go away. [SEP] best_answer: There is such a thing as Sun allergy (photo-sensitivity)

What Is It?

A sun allergy is an immune system reaction to sunlight, most often, an itchy red rash. The most common locations include the "V" of the neck, the back of the hands, the outside surface of the arms and the lower legs. In rare cases, the skin reaction may be more severe, producing hives or small blisters that may even spread to skin in clothed areas.

Sun allergies are triggered by changes that occur in sun-exposed skin. It is not clear why the body develops this reaction. However, the immune system recognizes some components of the sun-altered skin as "foreign," and the body activates its immune defenses against them. This produces an allergic reaction that takes the form of a rash, tiny blisters or, rarely, some other type of skin eruption.

Sun allergies occur only in certain sensitive people, and in some cases, they can be triggered by only a few brief moments of sun exposure. Scientists do not know exactly why some people develop a sun allergy and others do not. There is evidence, however, that some forms of sun allergy are inherited.

A few of the most common types of sun allergy are:

Polymorphous light eruption (PMLE) — PMLE, which usually appears as an itchy rash on sun-exposed skin, is the second most common sun-related skin problem seen by doctors, after common sunburn. It occurs in an estimated 10% to 15% of the U.S. population, affecting people of all races and ethnic backgrounds. Women are affected by PMLE more often than men, and symptoms typically begin during young adult life. In temperate climates, PMLE is usually rare in the winter, but common during the spring and summer months. In many cases, the PMLE rash returns every spring, immediately after the person begins spending more time outside. As spring turns into summer, repeated sun exposure may cause the person to become less sensitive to sunlight, and the PMLE rash either may disappear totally or gradually become less severe. Although the effects of this desensitisation process, called "hardening," usually last through the end of the summer, the PMLE rash often returns at full intensity the following spring.


Actinic prurigo (hereditary PMLE) — This inherited form of PMLE occurs in people of American Indian background, including the American Indian populations of North, South and Central America. Its symptoms are usually more intense than those of classic PMLE, and they often begin earlier, during childhood or adolescence. Several generations of the same family may have a history of the problem.


Photo allergic eruption — In this form of sun allergy, a skin reaction is triggered by the effect of sunlight on a chemical that has been applied to the skin (often an ingredient in sunscreen, fragrances, cosmetics or antibiotic ointments) or ingested in a drug (often a prescription medicine). Common prescription medicines that can cause a photo allergic eruption include antibiotics (especially tetracyclines and sulfonamides), phenothiazines used to treat psychiatric illness, diuretics for high blood pressure and heart failure, and certain oral contraceptives. The U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) also has linked some cases of photo allergic reaction to the nonprescription pain relievers ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin and others) and naproxen sodium (Aleve, Naprosyn and others).


Solar urticaria — This form of sun allergy produces hives (large, itchy, red bumps) on sun-exposed skin. It is a rare condition that most often affects young women.
Symptoms

Symptoms vary, depending on the specific type of sun allergy:

PMLE — PMLE typically produces an itchy or burning rash within the first two hours after sun exposure. The rash usually appears on sun-exposed portions of the neck, upper chest, arms and lower legs. In addition, there may be one to two hours of chills, headache, nausea and malaise (a general sick feeling). In rare case

question_title: Prior to the other question about my "issues"? [SEP] question_content: I have a really heavy flow and instead of having my period every month, i skip one or even two. I'm looking for something that can control i.e a birth control pill that isn't strong. [SEP] best_answer: There are tablets which you can take which aren't hormone based but which help to decrease the flow and the pain.

Mefenamic Acid is an anti-prostaglandin (prostaglandins cause the pain during your period) and you take it for a few days before your period is due and for the first couple of days of your period. It help reduce the pain, and also over time reduces the amount of blood loss.

Tranexamic acid is an anti-fibrinolytic and is used to reduce blood flow. 

Both tranexamic acid and mefenamic acid can be used together to reduce blood flow during a period. However, the best thing really is to go onto the birth control pill - it dramatically reduces bleeding and pain.

Also, since your periods are irregular, it may be worth speaking to your doctor about having blood tests done, or possibly an ultrasound to see whether you may have something like PCOS.

question_title: Is antiperspirant a cause of breast cancer? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: There is no good scientific evidence to support this claim. The American Cancer Society is not aware of any strong epidemiologic studies reporting a statistical association between breast cancer risk and antiperspirant use. 

To the contrary, a carefully-designed epidemiologic study of this issue published in 2002 compared 813 women with breast cancer and 793 women without the disease found no relationship between breast cancer risk and antiperspirant use, deodorant use, or underarm shaving. Likewise, we are not aware of any evidence that aluminum or any of the other chemicals in antiperspirants are mutagenic (cause DNA damage that can lead to cancer). Products such as antiperspirants are rigorously tested and evaluated by the FDA before they can be marketed. 

Another study published in 2003 reported that women who used underarm antiperspirant and shaved their underarms tended to be diagnosed with breast cancer at a younger age than women who do not. However, the study design did not include a control group of women without breast cancer and has been criticized by experts as not relevant to the safety of these underarm hygiene practices. It is likely that in general, young women are more likely than elderly women to shave their underarms, regardless of whether they later develop breast cancer. This is a more likely explanation of the researchersÂ’ findings than the suggestion that these practices cause cancer.

question_title: Should we celebrate my birthday or break up? [SEP] question_content: My boyfriend and I have been dating for over a year now.  When we are together, things are great but when we are apart, I question why we are together.  

He has been searching for apartments for us to live in, yet he is relcutant to sign a lease.  When I question him about it, he says he feels pressured.  And he's worried about his finances.

I told him that I feel as though he has been pushing me away and that he doesn't want to be with me.  His response is, "what do you want to do".  I asked if this was his way of getting me to break up with him.  He claims that he isn't pushing me away and isn't trying to get me to break up with him.  

My birthday is in a few days and he wants me to go to his place for a fun night full of suprises.  We got in a fight today and I said that I feel as though I am at the end of my rope and asked why I should see him.  He says "because you should want to spend your time with me.  We'll have fun and I love you and want to be with you." [SEP] best_answer: Hon, you said something very important..when he is around you you want to be with him but when he is not around you then you question why you are together.........this means that some way or another he is munipulating the situation. The way you feel when he is not around is KEY! 

Another thing, has it occured to you that he want you to be with him on your birthday cuz he don't want anyone else to be with you on your specail day? 

Another thing if he does not want to sign any lease or whatever then that is a big RED flag saying stop and re-evaluate the situation. 

Finally i say dump him and move on.You will find someone better for you.

question_title: what is love? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: That is a complicated question.  You will never know unless you find out for yourself.  Otherwise you can find the English definition, the bible verse, etc. describing love.  But love is more than just the words that describes it.  It is a feeling.  It is knowing that the person you love is trustworthy and worth caring for.  Love is also making sacrifices for someone.  Love is the smile on your face or the tear in your eye from a perfect memory of you and your loved one.  Whether it is a family member, spouse, or best friend, love is unconditional.  There are not enough words to write in this text box to say what love is.  So find out, and I grant you a good luck along your journey on the mystery road of love.

question_title: I want to get in contact with my ex? [SEP] question_content: Ok, here's the situation. Two weeks ago today I broke up with my boyfriend of six months. It was actually a mutual breakup though, since he had no objections. He and I had been fighting a lot during the last several weeks of the relationship. Before that, we were getting along pretty well, and were in love. He treated me very well before all the really bad fighting started. Two days after the breakup I sent him an email asking for forgiveness since I ended the relationship so abruptly and while his parents were still in town. (I met them a few days prior) He never replied to that email, though. Yesterday I really had the urge to talk to him, so I called him up and left a voicemail saying hi and that I'd like to still be friends if he wants to as well. So far he hasn't called me back. I'm having a really hard time letting go and moving on. I guess I still have some feelings for him. I think I'd feel so much if he'd contact me so we could talk. Anyone else going thru this? [SEP] best_answer: I can relate to your situation. I too had a relationship to where we were so "in love" in the first part of our 8 month relationship. It usually is happy during the first couple of months because of the excitement and the part of getting to know each other. Then for some it continues over because of good communication/trust and relating to each other. For some it ends up the opposite way. Insecurities play a major role in this. That's the reason for the fights. Ask yourself are you fighting over things that are small that somehow leads to big fights? Or does the fight continue like a broken record. There are issues revolving around the person that brings them up. Also ask yourself this. Do you miss his old self or do you miss the fights? If he doesn't make an attempt to return any of your calls, give him some time to heal or maybe it's time to move on. The problem could be him not being mature enough to handle a break up. I hope this help. Take care of yourself. you'll eventually meet someone who can be both your friend and your boyfriend.

question_title: how do you know when you are in love? [SEP] question_content: 10 [SEP] best_answer: You know.
It is an undeniable feeling that takes over your life.
You can't stop thinking about the person.
They are your main focus in life.
You want the best for that person.
You want to be with them most all the time.
Thinking about that special person puts a smile on your face.
The thought of harm coming to them scares the hell out of you.
You want to marry them.
You love to have converstations with them, especially about the future together.
You daydream about them when you are apart.

You KNOW... plain and simple.  You know.

question_title: Should I say it is okay for my ex-husband to move to Ireland? [SEP] question_content: This is sort of a an interesting situation. My ex-husband and his new wife are thinking about moving to Ireland and they want to know if I will let the kids visit them out there. I am a little concerned about them not letting the kids return, but the kids are 12 and 9 so I think it would be okay. My biggest concern is child support and health insurance. I had child support issues in the past.  He spent a couple of nights in jail and has has been better since, but in Ireland it will be harder to regulate and make him pay if he doesn't want to.  Also, Ireland apparently has public health care so he would have to get individual coverage for the kids (since I don't have group) which is not as good of coverage and there is also the issue of me having a harder time enforcing the divorce decree with him out of the country. What would you do? Does anybody know anything about Ireland as it pertaints to this situation? [SEP] best_answer: I'm not sure I would be willing to risk losing my children in the event that he decided to keep them.  And Ireland is way too far away for me to send my kids.  \n\nMaybe you should tell your ex that it's in the kids best interest for him to remain close for the next 9 years.

question_title: Hi, I am getting married very soon and I would like know what present to get my husband to be.? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Honestly, he is already leaving the wedding with the best present he could ever ask for, you!  At least that is how I feel about my upcoming wedding (5 days from today :D:D:D ).  As far as gifts, get him something that will show him just exactly how you feel about him.  Although guys do nto often show it, we like the little romantic gestures every once in a while too.  For me though, all my fiance has to give me is those two words at the alter and I am happy.  After all, the gift I am gettign that way will last for a lifetime, anything els that you give will be temporary.  I would suggest though, if you are going to give him a gift, make it kind of a combination of things.

1) Write him a little not telling him that you love him and teasing him for the night after the wedding (you knwo what I mean)

2) give him a serious gift, maybe a nice watch or something like that that you know he will appreciate.  Just pick something you know that hw is into, or maybe something he can use for the wedding.

3) give him a not so serious gift like something in there with a note telling him to look forward to you modeling it for him, or (even funnier) put a bag in there with nothing in it and a note on the outside saying that you are going to model in what is in that bag, he will get the idea.

To me, things like that that will both show how much you love him, care for him, and respect him along with things taht show how much you really do look forward to being with him for the rest of your life will be a wonderful gift to give on your wedding day.  Just be a little creative.  The joke things will lighten the mood and maybe ward off some of the pre-wedding jitters and the serious stuff will show him how you feel about him.  Hope this helps.

question_title: My husband prefers his exercise schedule over me.? [SEP] question_content: i feel frustrated and ignored .he does not have time to talk to me. any free time he has he spends exercising. i do not think he would brteak his exercise schdule even if i am dead . what do i do
p.s. i still love him [SEP] best_answer: Since your husband seems to like living his life by a schedule, ask him to start scheduling time for YOU! ... Like maybe a 'household business meeting' once a week, a 'social hour' a few times a few times a week, AND ... don't leave out scheduling romance.

When married people expect communication, caring, and romance to "just happen" or "be spontaneous" ... that is a recipe for NO communication, caring, or romance. These things happen when you plan for them and make them happen. 

Does a great dinner appear on the table spontaneously? Of course not, you have to plan the menu, plan the shopping. Just give him a day-planner or calendar and ask him to go over his schedule with you. Point out (nicely, without nagging) that he isn't scheduling any time for his marital responsibilities.

question_title: what is a crush for you? [SEP] question_content: Hi what is for you guys a crusch on someone? Is more then be attractive to someone? [SEP] best_answer: Yes, I feel that a crush is more than being attracted to someone.  One can be attracted to a lot of people, but that doesn't necessarily mean they have crushes on all of these people.

A crush, in my opinion, is when your heart beats faster at the thought that you will be with that person shortly; it means you take twice as long to groom yourself when you know you will see him; it means you can't keep your eyes off of him; it means you wait and wait sometimes for hours for him to call, and when the phone finally rings, your heart stops beating for a couple of seconds; it means you get jealous just at the thought that he may find another girl attractive, etc. etc. etc.

A crush is not true love.  Most people have many crushes on people in their lifetime.  However, true love usually only comes around once or twice in a lifetime.

Best of luck to you!!!!!

question_title: Losing a close friend because I fell in love with her...? [SEP] question_content: Recently I made the mistake of falling in love with a close friend of mine that I had known for years and been attracted to all the while. However, it was only recently that she became available and I took my chance, went out on a limb and told her how I felt. She wasn't interested in that kind of relationship with me, even though she had been giving me mixed signals from the very start. I woefully agreed. We then grew even closer as friends and she began "hanging of my arm." A day wouldn't go by where I wouldn't see her or she wouldn't call me. I approached her saying that this is proof that it could work between us. She dissagreed, but still continued the behavior. For the next six months I, in a sense, became her "emotional boyfriend." I was still hopelessly in love with her until recently we got into an argument that was totally unrelated to all of this. Since then we've gone from seeing eachother every day to 3 months of total non-communication. What should I do, leave it be? [SEP] best_answer: Yes, leave it be.  She is obviously unstable and whatever the outcome, it won't be fair to you.

question_title: What do you think about dating out of your race? [SEP] question_content: This was the response to a question someone posted on yahoo answers:

"...Black guys catch hell from black women around them and especially in their family. Black women hate seeing black guys dating white girls." 

My question is:

Is this statment (answer) true? 
What if an Afican American man dates other races like hispanics, Asians, Jews, or Indian. Is it the same or diffrent? 

I am just curious. Please give an extensive explination so that I may understand why people think this way. God bless you. [SEP] best_answer: Some black women have a hard time dealing with black men dating white women because they believe that there is a shortage of good black men and that the white women are stealing their men.  Being a white woman who has dated black men, I have experienced this.  But racism is certainly not limited to black women; I am Italian and my family is totally against interracial dating.  I believe that people should be free to date anyone they want; what matters is that they like each other and treat one another with respect.  Most people who oppose interracial dating do so because they fear that which they do not know.  The only way to improve the situation and stop the hatred is to just forge ahead and date whomever you want, no matter what people say.  Only love is real; the rest is superficial.

question_title: would you cheat on your husband and would you tell him? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Ok there are many people who are aghast at the idea of cheating let alone telling......

I will share my personal experience and you (Asker) and the rest of the folks can then determine what you all think is right, best etc.. for your own lives.

In THEORY, we were supposed to take our marriage vows to mean that we stated before God (or however you believe) that you would Love, Honor etc.. NOT CHEAT!  AGREED, those were the vows I took.

Next we have REALITY.. we have both partners working 40-70 hours a week, if you have children, that diminishes your alone time more than that and IF you had a 'perfect life' which hey, guess what - doesn't exist.. and HOW is it possible to meet each other's needs - physcially or emotionally in a RELATIVELY decent timely manner?  It isn't.. and most marriages would say 'it's really hard'.  That isn't an excuse - it's fact.  Look at our divorce rate/cheating rate!

I had an open marriage, and the agreement was that I could see other people with some very basic ground rules.. that I respected throughout the marriage and we divorced and remain friends today.  Do I *AGREE* with what I did - and the 'righteousness' of it all?  No, I do not.  If presented with the same scenario again in my life, would I exercise that freedom, No, I would not... HOWEVER..to make this crystal clear - not ONCE did I LIE to my Ex-hubby about what I was doing or with whom.  It's not right in God's eyes in the 'marriage' contract, but at the end of the day, I felt I did that with the BEST dignity possible toward my mate.. if it had to be that way (and he was pushing me to do it), then the least I could do was be honest/honorable about it.

50% of marriages have a cheating partner, and I think that in order for us all to recognize that, we have to get off our 'soap boxes' about the holier than thou attitudes because guaranteed, one of you is probably getting cheated on who answered this post.  It is a very REAL problem and almost as many women as men are out there cheating today!

When the Asker asked - would you tell him?  I believe that if she wants that marriage to work....... YES she needs to tell him. HE IS OWED THAT HONESTY/RESPECT! They need to be honest with each other to have the opportunity to rebuild their marriage...and she cannot do that 'holding this in'.  Guilt eats at your very soul, and while yes it will hurt him and them, if they have any hope of fixing it, she needs to fess up.  If it's broken for good, she's probably prepared for that, as she knows that 'she screwed up' by doing what she did, and SHE ALONE has the guilt and forgiveness to ask for from both spouse and her God.  

I do believe I did the best I could do at the time and I am not proud of myself in certain areas, and I did learn some valuable lessons.. that maybe weren't conventional lessons, but nonetheless hard lessons, that I hope to pass on to other people in situations before they 'go there' or to 'offer the I have been there' part and help them heal, versus passing the judgement.  People feel bad enough, they don't need the morality crap thrown at them.  That's my 2 copper, feel free to sling the immoral and hate mail my way.. /shrug..

question_title: Why do people watch wresting if we all know its fake? [SEP] question_content: wrestling [SEP] best_answer: Would you please stop parroting the same old tired "it's fake" cliche? We get it, ok? People who watch wrestling realize the outcomes are predetermined; they watch it because it is pure escapist fun, a sort of soap opera that both males and females can get into. I am sure there are a few slack-jawed yokels out there who think it's all real, but 99.99999 % of wrestling fans know it isn't. It's not a sport; it's called sports ENTERTAINMENT. I can tell you what's NOT fake...the blood, the occasional serious injury, and the athletic ability of the performers.

question_title: Why when I workout, I feel great the next day, but feel sore 2 days after? [SEP] question_content: When I work out I feel great the next day, but the muscles feel so sore two days after, why? [SEP] best_answer: Its called DOMS..delay onset muscle soreness. It happens when you haven't worked out for a long time and your muscles are just trying to get use to it. It also happens when you don't stretch really good before you workout. what ever muscles you plan on working on, those are the muscles that you need to stretch the most. When there is to much lactate acid in the muscle and not enough ATP being made, it can , well there more to it than that. But just try stretching more and then you should be ok.

question_title: Ever been to John Pennekamp Coral Reef State Park? [SEP] question_content: what is your opinion?  did you camp?  did you kayak?  did you dive?  did you snorkel? where is the best place to get a good shot of the sunrise, or sunset?  let me know about your experience with the park. thouse who fill in the most details will be voted best. [SEP] best_answer: I've been there several times as I lived nearby for six years. You can rent kayaks, snorkel, and dive in several places along the keys. I went snorkeling off of Key Largo and there's plenty to see. If you are interested in seeing sharks I recommend getting a kayak and go to Cudjoe Key which is a few miles up from Key West. Expect to see black tip reef and nurse sharks, sting rays are plenty. If you snorkel, watch for jellies, they will leave you itching. \n\nI don't know of any camping on the keys but if you have the time I believe you can overnight at the Dry Tortugas which is off the coast of Key West therefore only accessible by plane or boat, this former military fort site has excellent snorkeling.  Best place to get a sunrise/sunset pic is there and another good sunset pic would be from Mallory Square in Key West. Be sure to catch the Sunset Celebration every night at Mallory Square, too! Sunrise pics are best from the east side of any island. There are plenty of web sites you can get info from. Don't forget sunscreen!!!

question_title: What is the history of reverse swing? [SEP] question_content: 10 points for right answer,  how ever there isn't a preset right answer.  Anything close to right lines will be fine. [SEP] best_answer: The initial exponents of reverse swing mostly been Pakistani fast bowlers: Sarfraz Nawaz and Imran Khan are often credited as the first bowlers to produce reverse swing, and they have been followed by bowlers such as Wasim Akram, Waqar Younis,Irfan Pathan,Aaqib Javed, Shoaib Akhtar,Darren Gough, Andrew Flintoff and Simon Jones. In the early days of reverse swing, the Pakistani bowlers were suspected of using unfair means to achieve it, but today they are considered to have been simply ahead of their time.

question_title: I think Lennox Lewis is greatest champ ever, whay do you yhink? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I agree with you completely. Lennox Lewis is the greatest champion and the greatest boxer in the history of this sport. First he had an excellent amateur career that he crowned with an Olympic gold medal in 1988, and as a professional he was in my opinion the greatest heavyweight champion ever to step foot in a boxing ring. He defeated every opponent he ever faced in his career (McCall and Rahman by a way of rematch) and he had all the attributes that a perfect heavyweight boxer is supposed to have - starting from basic height, weight and strenght advantage in almost every match to perfect technique, awesome knockout power and most importantly unprecedented boxing talent that he has been showing throughout his career.\nAli, Fraiser, Liston, Foreman, Holyfield, Tyson, Klitschko brothers and so on are all great heavyweight boxing champions but none of them is a match for Lennox in my opinion.

question_title: in softball what is the uniform for softball? [SEP] question_content: do you where pants and a shirt and a cap and the other stuff or is it shirt and shorts, i want to know the uniform for A.P.Gianninni Middle School in San Francisco, Oretega street [SEP] best_answer: A typical softball uniform consists of a short-sleeved or sleeveless jersey supplied by the organization, shorts or sliding pants, and stirrup or other high socks.  Anything goes, really; jerseys vary from cotton tees to polyester baseball-styled ones.  Pants can be full-length or cropped below the knee to show your socks.  Shorts come in a huge variety of fabrics, but polyester, mesh, or nylon are the most common.  In colder climates, long-sleeved shirts are often worn under jerseys.  Most teams wear visors as well.  In addition to the uniform, many girls wear sliding shorts to prevent abrasion to the hip and a slider to keep your legs from being cut.  Cleats are worn by most players.  If you want to learn more, you can try looking at products on www.softball.com- they have equipment and clothing.

question_title: Is highschool wrestling dangerous? [SEP] question_content: im in highschool, and i wanted to do wrestling. my parents refused cuz my older brother got a concussion and changed his eating habits. they also say all wrestlers are short cuz it's bad for your growth plates (picking up your opponent), and they are all fat/bulky. i disagree. [SEP] best_answer: My son wrestled in Junior high and High school 7 years. And yes you do get injured sometimes. And it does not matter if you follow the safety guidelines. Things happen he has had concussions, seperated ribs, broken fingers and more. Also depends on your coach. My sons coach was a jerk who only wanted trophys and nothing less. So my sons eating habits changed and so did his attitude. I was glad when he got out of school just because of the things that happened. If you want to wrestle look into it more do some research on your coaches and the school wrestling team. Personally I think it is a great sport if it is taught right. But be aware you can and will be injured wrestiling. Sit down and have a heart to heart with your parents but do what they say. You will look back as you get older and thank them. Besides maybe there is a local boys and girls club that you can wrestle at?? But this is my personal experience with wrestling. I can tell you a lot about junior high and high school wrestling. At least what happened with my son.

question_title: is tiki barber's early announcement for retirement the reason why the giants are struggling? [SEP] question_content: It has been noted that the Giants lack "leadership" how can you be a good leader when you say you are quitting on your team in the middle of the season? [SEP] best_answer: Injuries are the reason (though that's a cop out, the chargers D is worse off, and they're still winning).  You also have to put some of it on Eli, and some of it on bad play calling.  Eli has never been great, and lately he's been looking Leaf-esqe, and that has alot to do with it.  Also, sticking with the pass when it's obviously not working is killing them, they need to be treating Manning like a struggling young QB and have him hand the ball off to Barber and make short confidence passes, they're putting too much on his shoulders and he isn't good enough to win games for them.  Barber's retirement doesn't have anything to do with it.  When they suck next year, that's when you can blame it on Barber.

question_title: what size portable generator do i need for a 50 amp circute on a camper? [SEP] question_content: I am trying to figure out what size generator i need my camper is 50 amp with 2 air conditioners, mircowave,refrigator [SEP] best_answer: Most generators are rated in watts. If you have a 50 amp circuit, then 110 volts x 50 amps = 5500 watts. You do not want to run the generator past 80% of its duty cycle, so a 6000 watt gen should be the best.
Hope the formula helps
You can also figure out how many watts a microwave will need. I it takes 10 amps at start up then 10 x 110 = 1100 watts.
Thus a 60 watt light bulb would take 60/110= .54 amps

question_title: who watches pride fighting championships (bushido)?? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: I do. These Bushido tournaments are great but i think that tournaments that Pride put previously in heavyweight and lightheavyweight division and specially this year's Open Weight Grand Prix are lot more entertaining. There are some outstanding fighters there like Dan Henderson, Murilo Bustamante, Paolo Filho, Takanori Gomi, Joachim Hansen, Tatsuya Kawajiri and so on, and they put on excellent fights but I just think that PRIDE's heavyweights and lightheavyweights are more fun to watch.\n\nP. question_title: What do you think of Gerhard Berger's reputation as the paddock prankster throughout his career? [SEP] question_content: He always said about his friendship with Senna: "He taught me a lot about the sport. I taught him TO LAUGH."\nSome of his pranks were: throwing Ayrton's briefcase out of a hovering helicopter, claiming to have filled his room with snakes and frogs or changing his passport photo in order to resemble... other bits of the body; or ruining a computer by soaking it in water and so on. He was a funny presence in the paddock if you could avoid being on the receiving end of his jokes.\nThankfully, now I haven't heard about any new pranks since he has become the boss at Toro Rosso. But what do you think? [SEP] best_answer: As a prankster myself, I'm all for him.  He also gave me an insight into living life that I use just about every day.  A reporter asked him how he felt about Senna's death, and he said that it affected him (obviously) in a bad way and he started to think about racing in a different formula or other cars and then he says "And then I said no, either you do it or you don't do it".  Just so simple and wise I thought.  No dancing around.

question_title: Where is James Buster Douglas now? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: "Recent Events and Current Status:

On August 8, 2006, Douglas pleaded not guilty to a charge of allowing his brother to use his identity to apply for a motorcycle license. Douglas was formally charged with a misdemeanor count of complicity in June as the result of William Douglas III's, his 36-year-old brother, attempt to use his name and identity to obtain the license for him. William Douglas III pleaded not guilty to a falsification charge on August 8, 2006. Each charge carries a maximum of six months in jail upon conviction.

Ohio Bureau of Motor Vehicles investigators said on June 8 that Buster Douglas waited in a car outside a BMV office in Columbus while his brother got a license for him. A clerk challenged William Douglas' identity, BMV spokesman Fred Stratmann said after the charges were filed.[1]

According to public court filings, Douglas currently resides on the far east side of Columbus.


[edit] Trivia
Made his feature film acting debut in the Artie Knapp science fiction comedy film Pluto's Plight. 
Douglas was the star of the video game "James 'Buster' Douglas Knockout Boxing" for the Sega Master System and Sega Genesis. This game is considered as a response to Nintendo's Mike Tyson's Punch-Out!!, especially since Tyson lost to Douglas, which Sega took advantage in order to promote their early Genesis does what Nintendon't advertisements. The game turned out to be a huge disappoinment while its competition remains a classic to this day. 
A week and a half after defeating Mike Tyson, Douglas replaced him as special guest referee for the Hulk Hogan vs. Randy Savage match at WWF's The Main Event III. After the conclusion of the match, Douglas knocked Savage to the canvas with two punches. After the match, the media had a field day ridiculing Douglas' involvement with the WWF, raising the question of why it took the heavyweight champion of boxing two punches to knock out a wrestler. 
Douglas is one of the few non-students to be honored by The Ohio State University with the opportunity to dot the "i" during the performance of Script Ohio. "

question_title: how do u get ready the day before a bball game? [SEP] question_content: from wat to eat to how to stretch [SEP] best_answer: "stretch and drink water"? the day before? LOL. Dude you dont do anything the day before a game lol. You relax, and if yer a pitcher you go over hitters scouting reports, if yer a position player you just relax, if you got treatment for any ailment, you got it days prior to playing. On the day you play, before you play you hydrate with water if its hot out, you loosen up yer joints and muscles by stretching, you get yer pregame run in if yer into that, you get yer BP in, and maybe you get fly balls hit to you if yer an OF and grounders if yer an infielder. but the day before a game, you just relax. get yer rest, no partying.

question_title: Anyone know any websites that are similar to the "for Dummies" series, but pertaining to guns.? [SEP] question_content: I work in a sporting goods shop that sells ammo/guns/pistols and I am not very knowledgeable about them.  I need to learn which gun and ammo for what situation.  Basically "the basics". [SEP] best_answer: i looked a little for ya, it is a confusing and vast subject, but This link may help with the ammunition;

http://members.aol.com/vaquero760/ammo/amain.htm

as for the guns them selves, as basic as it gets,

shotguns = bird or deer hunting as well as "skeet/sport" shooting. There are 3 different types, "side by side" (2 barrels next to each other) "over-under" (2 barrels 1 on top of the other) and a "single barrel", this can be in "pump" (like in movies they manually pull the fore-grip back to re-load) or semi-auto (as a bullet is fired the gun re-loads itself. There are many "gauges" today typically they are 12ga. 16ga. & 20ga. (gauge is just a different term for the size of the bullet) They fire slugs (solid bullet) or "shot" (this is where it gets it's name, think of it as a bunch of BBs they come in different size as well)

rifles= target, hunting, most any game other than birds. basically the bigger the caliber (or bullet size) the bigger the target i.e. deer vs brown bear.

handguns = personal defense, hunting, target. Basics, 2 types "revolver" (re-loads as you pull the trigger) this is your "cowboy" type gun, typically 6 bullets & 
"semi-auto" (re-loads it's self after each bullet) these are the firearms most police dept carry, and are used in most movies, they offer larger capacity, some up to 15 bullets typically these are easier to shoot for "first time shooters" calibers range just as rifles, different size for different job

Hope I didn't overwhelm you. If you would like someone to answer any questions, e-mail me direct I would be more than happy awtcw@comcast.net  :-)

question_title: Do yellow cards carry over after the group stages of the world cup? [SEP] question_content: Sometimes all cards count and continue. Other times one yellow is resinded at the end of the group stage. [SEP] best_answer: Carry on the cautions (Yellow card)
The exact punishments are determined by tournament or competition rules (not by the Laws of the Game). The cautions are accumulate for a certain phase of a the world cup tournament.
Rules:
* A yellow card is carry over, and 2 yellow cards equal a red and a 1 game suspension.
* A yellow card is carry on during the first and second phase of the tournament.
* For the quaterfinals is a clean start for all the players, except for a red card.
* Begining the quaterfinals the yellow cards are carry on, until the end of the tournament. And at the end of the tournament all the yellows cards are reset, except:
If a player gets his second yellow card, in the final game, he will carry over the punishment to the next international game of his team, when he plays.

question_title: how do i prep or condition a new baseball glove? [SEP] question_content: new left handers youth baseball glove [SEP] best_answer: USE THE DANG GLOVE...oil it up, put a ball in it, rubber band it.  Those are all goood things to do, but how is the glove going to mold to your hand if its never been on your hand?\nOil it once, let it sit with the ball in it.  Put the ball in the webbing of the glove and wrap the finger part, pinky, into the thumb.  Rubber band it and let it dry.  Then go play catch.\nAfter about 2-5 days of this the glove will be set to play with.

question_title: how to begin teaching forward rolls? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Begin discussing on safety and spotting. When teaching any tumbling keep the safety of the students formost. Make sure the practice mat is long enough for each student.

Then demostrate by performing one in step by step motiong and explain each step.

Stand at the end of the mat.

Squat, placing hands in front of the feet.

Tuck head between the knees

Lean forward and push off with your toes. Aim to have the back of your shoulders be the first roll over contact on the mat (not the head or neck). 

Keep tucked and keep rolling till your feet touch the mat again. Place your hands to the side and slightly in front of your feet and push to an standing position.

For spotting: Spotter squats beside the student. As the student tucks their head, place one hand at the back of the shoulders and the other on the buttocks. As the student leans forward and tucks their head gently push on the back of the shoulder in toward the student and up as they continue rolling forward to make sure they land on the back of the shoulders and not the head of neck. Continue to follow the student and assist as needed to complete the roll.

question_title: What are the importance of the Navajo Code Talkers? [SEP] question_content: What Contribution did the Navajo Code Talkers give to the WW2 [SEP] best_answer: The Japanese were expert code breakers.  The Navajo or "Dine" language is unlike any other language on the planet.  it's characteristics are unique and not based on other languages, and not spoken commonly outside of the Navajo community.  Because of this, the Japanese were unable to "break the code" of the Navajo language.  The Navajo, because of this were able to speak freely to one another over the radio, without fear of having their conversations translated.  Nonetheless, the Navajo had to learn specific "code words", as there were no such words for "tank" or "airplane" in the language.  Because of this in part, America was able to win WWII.

question_title: solve using two equations with two variables? [SEP] question_content: High school musical.  El Segundo High School put on their annual muscial. The students sold 650 tickets for a value of $4375. If orchestra seats cost $7.50 and balcony seats cost $3.50, how many of each kind of seat were sold? [SEP] best_answer: to complete the problem:
7.5o + 3.5b = 4375  Eq.#1
o + b = 650  Eq.#2

Solve Eq.#2 for o:
o = 650 - b  Eq.#3

Substitute Eq.#3 into Eq.#1:
7.5(650-b) + 3.5b = 4375
4875 - 7.5b + 3.5b = 4375

Solve for 'b':
4875 - 4375 = 7.5b - 3.5b
500 = 4b
b = 125

Substitute b = 125 into Eq. #2:
o + 125 = 650
o = 600-125
o = 525

Therefore, there were 125 balcony seats sold, and 525 orchestra seats sold.

question_title: What do you do about the teacher's at a school who don't do their jobs? [SEP] question_content: I recently checked my daughter's homework, and found out something really astonishing! She had left her questions for the book they were reading at school, but remembered the first and last question, so she answered those. The other 3 she wrote in " don't have the questions, so I will tomorrow" The teacher marked it all as "right"and gave her full marks for it. I couldn't believe it!!! And we wonder why our children are passing grades, but still can't add, write, or read. What can be done about this? We also recently found out the class average is only 38%, for the whole class!!! Either the teacher is a really crappy teacher, or every kid in the class is stupid!!! And i don't think that the kids are stupid!!! Your opinion and suggestions would be apprieciated. [SEP] best_answer: Please do talk to the teacher first, so you will have gone through steps.  Principals may ignore you if you haven't at least spoken with the teacher.  Please be as diplomatic as possible so you don't get labeled as a problem parent and then ignored.  Then, very soon, take your concern to the principal.  He/she will probably want a meeting with you and the teacher.  Come with documentation, but be sure to continue to be diplomatic.  Make appointments to observe your daughter (not the teacher) in class.  Be sure to keep every piece of paper you have that might show incompetance.  For all you know, the principal and school board are already working on getting rid of her.  It takes about three years to get rid of a poor teacher if people are trying.  Unfortunately, good teachers can also be hounded out of jobs by incompetant administrators, so do make sure that this wasn't a fluke, or a case where she was overwhelmed with grading and just took it as a completion grade (not checked for accuracy).  If you are in an elementary school, you can lobby to have your child transfered to another class, but you will never be able to do that again, and will be labeled as a problem parent.  If you are in a middle or high school, make friends with the counselor so that your child is not placed in that teacher's class again.\nThe class average of 38%--do you know what this means?  38% passed a national standardized test?  38% of them have a C average or better in class?  The class has a 38% on all their work?  \nGood luck

question_title: Lined end to end, how many Twinkies do I need to reach the moon? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Ok here it goes: The distance to the moon is 384,401km The length of a twinkie is 9.9cm. There are 100,000cm in 1km. That means there are 10,101 twinkies per km. So the distance to the moon 384,401 multiplied by the number of twinkies in a km 10,101 would equal 3,882,834,501. \n\nSo you need 3,882,834,501 twinkies to reach the moon.

question_title: how would I solve the equation 4 over 3x-2 minus 9x over 3x+2 equals negative 3? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: the LCD will be (3x-2)(3x+2)
4/(3x-2)-9x(3x+2)=-3
4(3x+2)-9x(3x-2)=-3(3x-2)(3x+2)
12x+8-27x^2+18x=-3(9x^2-4)
-27x^2+30x+8=-27x^2+12
adding 27x^2
30x+8=12
adding -8
30x=4
dividing by 30
x=4/3=>2/15

question_title: Why is it that 95% of the population appears to lack even fundamental spelling and grammar skills? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Because nobody cares about grammar and spelling anymore.  When my stepson would say something like, "Him and me are going to the store" I would correct him by saying, "You mean, 'he and I'." His response would always be, "whatever."

There's also this fad in education now where you teach "writing" first without worrying about spelling or grammar.  The idea is that it gets them writing sooner and they can learn spelling and grammar later.  The problem is that they never learn spelling or grammar because it's too late.

It's very frustrating.

question_title: how do i get financial aid for college if i dont have a proof of income? I am filing for independence.? [SEP] question_content: I dont have certain papers for adopted child. [SEP] best_answer: As long as you have a Social Security Number, go ahead and fill out the Free Application for Federal Student Aid (FAFSA).  Go to www.fafsa.ed.gov.  It asks a variety of questions, including how much your family can contribute to your education (which if filing for independence would be $0).  It also asks for your personal contributions, which would also be $0.  Depending on the school to which you apply, there are a variety of grants, both federal and institutionally-based that can help with your education costs.  But none of the work on it can really get started without the FAFSA.

question_title: how can i make a static atomic model displaying electronic configuration of the first eighteen elements? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: The nucleus is easy to model you just need little balls to represent the neutrons and protons. The click it magnetic balls spray painted to represent protons and neutrons may work, otherwise buy little round balls and spray paint them.

You have a few options when you are modeling the electrons orbiting the nucleus you can either string beads on wires to represent the number of electrons (the planetary model). Or string the electrons in the Bohr model.

If you are going to be more accurate you need to put the electrons in the electron shells. 

You could make the shell shapes out of wire http://www.steve.gb.com/science/atomic_structure.html and string in the right number of bead electrons or you can try and make plastic representations of the shells and paint the electrons on the shell.

There are kits at indigo.com that represent the electron shell shapes, those may be worth buying

question_title: Who is the famous man?  What is the landmark? [SEP] question_content: In 1848, in order to meet the increasing demand for his wire rope - this famous resident opened a factoy in this state.Later his wire rope(cable) was used to build one of the most famous landmark - approximately 60 miles from his factory. The famous landmark would be the Brooklyn Bridge.\n\nIf you need more info, try what I did in your search engine. question_title: floristry question? [SEP] question_content: Hi there,

I applied for the btec floristry diploma course but it was already full so I have to waste a whole year waiting to join next years course.
I have taken it in my own hands and found 2 florists to take me on and train me up.

What I would like to know is:
           Can I take any exams without being at college,i mean doing it though the florist?

If there are any exams outside of college what are they please?

Any info on this at all will be helpful


THANKS VERY MUCH

Bell [SEP] best_answer: There are no minimum qualifications to become a florist, although some employers prefer some GCSEs/S grades (A-E/1-5). English, maths, art and craft subjects are especially useful. 

Foundation and Advanced Modern Apprenticeships (Skillseekers in Scotland) may be available for school-leavers. In Wales, National Traineeships and Modern Apprenticeships may be available. There are NVQs/SVQs are available in Floristry at Levels 2 and 3. 

Some colleges offer courses leading to the following qualifications: 

BTEC First Diploma in Floristry - no particular entry qualifications are required, although some GCSEs/S grades or their equivalent may be useful. 

BTEC National Diploma in Floristry -people usually need four GCSEs/S grades (A*-C/1-3), a relevant BTEC first award or Intermediate GNVQ/GSVQ Level II, appropriate SQA modules or other equivalent qualifications. 

BTEC Higher National Diploma in Floristry - usually requiring five GCSEs/S grades (A-C/1-3) and one A level/two H grades, or a relevant BTEC national diploma, or appropriate SQA modules or equivalent such as a vocational A level/GSVQ Level III. 

City & Guilds National Certificate in Professional Floristry - usually requiring an NVQ/SVQ Level 2 in Floristry. 

There is no upper age limit for becoming a florist. 

The minimum entry requirements for courses may be waived for adult entrants.

question_title: what is baptism? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: Today, water baptism is most readily identified with Christianity, where it symbolizes the cleansing (remission) of sins, and the union of the believer with Christ in His death, burial and resurrection so that he becomes one of Christ's Faithful.

question_title: Why must kids learn spanish in school? [SEP] question_content: I don't think it's important to learn any language unless you want to learn one.  It ticks me off that the schools push learning spanish!!!  I don't care if my son gets bad grades in this class because it isn't important. [SEP] best_answer: I feel that anytime a class like that is offered you should allow your child to take it.  Any additonal free classes like that will only help in the long run.  For example; college admission; better jobs.  My daughter was introduced to several languages in our school system when she was smaller.  She is now finishing her 4th year and will receive an Advanced Diploma when she graduates from High School in 2007.(and will have 5 years of Spanish)  Most colleges look for a secondary language or require it for admission.  But clearly if your child truly does not like the class I agree that something else should be offered to those students.  (Choir, Art, Self Defense)  Maybe you could approach your local school board with these questions or start with the teachers/principals.  I really wished that I had parental and educational guidance when I was her age, to send me or even encourage me to try something new.  I would be making more money with another language today, if I had taken spanish.  Good luck.

question_title: Can some one answer this riddle for me? [SEP] question_content: I turn polar bears white
and I will make you cry.
I make guys have to pee
and girls comb their hair.
I make celebrities look stupid
and normal people look like celebrities.
I turn pancakes brown
and make your champane bubble.
If you sqeeze me, I'll pop.
If you look at me, you'll pop.
Can you guess the riddle? [SEP] best_answer: CO2 - Carbon Dioxide.

Polar bears APPEAR white under the heavy CO2 atmosphere at the Pole.
Tears are made in CO2 rich ducts.
Urine is developed by combining CO2 and ammonia.
CO2 in the atmosphere creates dry hair.
CO2 is a component of Botox.
Pancakes go brown when the oxidise carboon as they overheat.
Champagne bubbles are CO2.
CO2 is a gas - if you inflate something with it and squeeze it, it will burst.
I can only guess the last bit has something to do with breathing CO2.

Hope this helps.

question_title: what is the history of david berkowitz (son of sam)? [SEP] question_content: I'm doing a paper on son of sam and need more background info such as military, childhood, relationships, etc.. [SEP] best_answer: David Richard Berkowitz (born June 1, 1953 in Brooklyn, New York), better known by his nickname Son of Sam, is an infamous serial killer who killed six people and wounded several others in the late 1970s. His given name was Richard David Falco; Berkowitz was the name of his adoptive parents. His birth parents were Betty Broder, who grew up into a poor Jewish family, and Joseph Kleinman, with whom Broder had an affair while still married to her husband, Tony Falco [1]. When Broder told Kleinman that she was pregnant, he told her to get rid of the baby.

question_title: When listing items do you put a comma before the word "and"? [SEP] question_content: In the third grade I was taught to not put a comma before the word and. And then in the fifth grade I was told the opposite. Which do you do? [SEP] best_answer: A comma separates the last two items in a series even though these items are linked by a conjunction. This comma was once considered optional, but the trend is to make it mandatory, especially in technical and business English. Leaving it out can cause confusion and misinterpretation.

question_title: For Parents Of School Children Please? [SEP] question_content: How important is it that your child get a proper education?  Even if it's public school isn't there things you do at home to help?  I've seen a lot of questions like "Why should I send my son to school?"  WTF??? It really makes me wonder if there are parents who care about education any more.  How do you feel about it? [SEP] best_answer: I don't have children but I hope you don't mind that I answer your question anyway =)\n\nA proper education is so important for childen! I feel very strongly about this. Whether it's homeschooling, public, private, whatever, kids have got to learn! It's difficult to get a job without a college degree these days. How much harder will it be if these kids don't get any kind of formal training at all? Even though I don't have kids, I don't mind that some of my taxes go to my town's schools, because I'm investing in these kids' lives, you know? They should have every possible advantage, and an education is one of those things.

question_title: What high school courses do you need to get a engineering degree in university.? [SEP] question_content: I live in canada and i was wondering what highschool courses you need to get a  into university with an eginering degree. Do you need advanced math or just normal math? What marks do you need for a scholership? What types of jobs can you get with this degree? [SEP] best_answer: I'm a Civil Engineer and the answer to your question depends on the type of engineering that you want to pursue.  Most types will require math and possibly science courses.  You need to choose the type first (civil, mechanical, electrical, etc.) then within those types you also need to consider what you want to do - do you want to do design, research, construction, etc.  If you like office work and are good mathmatically you may want to look towards design whereas if you like being outside and seeing engineering in practice you may go down a different path.  Set you path to your abilities and your interests.  If you enjoy something you will do better at it and this is a lifetime choice so think wisely.

question_title: Do we really need to read books? At what age? [SEP] question_content: one variant: Do we need to read books when we are 16-22? Why? [SEP] best_answer: People between the ages of 16-22 many times are very busy in their everyday lives.  There is homework, afterschool sports or other activities, time spent with friends and family, maybe a job too.  Sometimes it is hard to find time to fit in reading just for fun too.

I would still encourage people of all ages to take time out to read as a gift to themselves. There are sooo many really good books that you could literally read all day, everyday, for your whole life and still not be able to read all the good stuff.

If you get stuck for ideas, go to the library and talk to the reference librarian.  They will be able to help you find something that you will like.

question_title: what are the functions of ecowas? [SEP] question_content: what are the functions of ecowas [SEP] best_answer: The Economic Community of West African States (ECOWAS) is a regional group initially of sixteen countries, founded on May 28, 1975 when sixteen West African countries signed the Treaty of Lagos. Its mission is to promote economic integration. It was founded to achieve "collective self-sufficiency" for the member states by means of economic and monetary union creating a single large trading bloc. The very slow progress towards this aim meant that the treaty was revised in Cotonou on 24 July 1993 towards a looser collaboration. The ECOWAS Secretariat and the Fund for Cooperation, Compensation and Development are its two main institutions to implement policies. The ECOWAS Fund was transformed into the ECOWAS Bank for Investment and Development in 2001

question_title: How can foreign law graduate practice law in US? [SEP] question_content: I'm LLB (Bachelor in law) from India. I have been practicing law fro more than 3 years after passin Bar council exam in india. I want to study and practice law in US. What is the eligibility for sitting in Bar exam? Do I need to do LLM from some US law university? What are the requirements of Maryland state bar? How many credits do I need to study for LLM to sit for Maryland or DC or NY Bar exam? I have heard that its different from state to state. What are the job prospects for foreign lawyer after doing LLM in US? How much time does it take to finish study before becoming atorney in US if you start with LLM and already LLB from India? I would highly appreciate answers to my questions. Thanks.. [SEP] best_answer: Eligibility for sitting the bar varies state to state.
You do not need to do LLM in US to be eligible to sit bar exam.
Requirements for MD, NY and DC can be attained from the law practicing legislation in each respective state from the law society.
Job prospects are very similar regardless of country of origin or nationality. defining characteristics are talent, finance and friends in high places, such as judges and politicians.
It would be several years study to upgrade qualification from LLB to LLM.

question_title: Why is green the color associated with envy/jealousy? [SEP] question_content: i need this for my homework [SEP] best_answer: Jealousy is often known as the green-eyed monster. The phase appears to have been coined by Skakespeare and used in the Merchant of Venice.

Portia: ' How all the other passions fleet to air, As doubtful thoughts, and rash-embraced despair, And shuddering fear, and green-eyed jealousy! O love, Be moderate; allay thy ecstasy, In measure rein thy joy; scant this excess. I feel too much thy blessing: make it less, For fear I surfeit.'

He used the allusion again in Othello:

Iago: 'O, beware, my lord, of jealousy; It is the green-eyed monster which doth mock The meat it feeds on; that cuckold lives in bliss Who, certain of his fate, loves not his wronger; But, O, what damned minutes tells he o'er Who dotes, yet doubts, suspects, ye 

Green was traditionally a colour associated with sickness as many sick people have a greenish tinge. Shakespeare was arguing that people are sick with jealousy thus affecting their reason.

question_title: Creaming of the Well, the person who drinks from the well first is guaranteed what? [SEP] question_content:  [SEP] best_answer: It's actually "Cream of the well" - the noun (meaning "best of"), not the verb.  That would be the very first water drawn from the well. I can see where the first water drawn from a well each day will probably be the best - the well is probably stirred up whenever water is taken out, then settles overnight.

The superstition is that the first unmarried lass who gets water from the well on Hogmanay (Scottish New Years) will be married within the year, and if she brings water to a guy, he will be her husband.

Foretelling who will a maid marry has to be one of the most common forms of superstition.

question_title: What did benjerman Franklin Invent? [SEP] question_content: Please leave links [SEP] best_answer: Benjamin Franklin was born in Boston on January 17, 1706. He was the tenth son of soap maker, Josiah Franklin. Benjamin's mother was Abiah Folger, the second wife of Josiah. In all, Josiah would father 17 children.

Josiah intended for Benjamin to enter into the clergy. However, Josiah could only afford to send his son to school for one year and clergymen needed years of schooling. But, as young Benjamin loved to read he had him apprenticed to his brother James, who was a printer. After helping James compose pamphlets and set type which was grueling work, 12-year-old Benjamin would sell their products in the streets.

Apprentice Printer
When Benjamin was 15 his brother started The New England Courant the first "newspaper" in Boston. Though there were two papers in the city before James's Courant, they only reprinted news from abroad. James's paper carried articles, opinion pieces written by James's friends, advertisements, and news of ship schedules.

Benjamin wanted to write for the paper too, but he knew that James would never let him. After all, Benjamin was just a lowly apprentice. So Ben began writing letters at night and signing them with the name of a fictional widow, Silence Dogood. Dogood was filled with advice and very critical of the world around her, particularly concerning the issue of how women were treated. Ben would sneak the letters under the print shop door at night so no one knew who was writing the pieces. They were a smash hit, and everyone wanted to know who was the real "Silence Dogood."

After 16 letters, Ben confessed that he had been writing the letters all along. While James's friends thought Ben was quite precocious and funny, James scolded his brother and was very jealous of the attention paid to him.

Before long the Franklins found themselves at odds with Boston's powerful Puritan preachers, the Mathers. Smallpox was a deadly disease in those times, and the Mathers supported inoculation; the Franklins' believed inoculation only made people sicker. And while most Bostonians agreed with the Franklins, they did not like the way James made fun of the clergy, during the debate. Ultimately, James was thrown in jail for his views, and Benjamin was left to run the paper for several issues.

Upon release from jail, James was not grateful to Ben for keeping the paper going. Instead he kept harassing his younger brother and administering beatings from time to time. Ben could not take it and decided to run away in 1723.

Escape to Philadelphia

Running away was illegal. In early America, people all had to have a place in society and runaways did not fit in anywhere. Regardless Ben took a boat to New York where he hoped to find work as a printer. He didn't, and walked across New Jersey, finally arriving in Philadelphia via a boat ride. After debarking, he used the last of his money to buy some rolls. He was wet, disheveled, and messy when his future wife, Deborah Read, saw him on that day, October, 6, 1723. She thought him odd-looking, never dreaming that seven years later they would be married.

Franklin found work as an apprentice printer. He did so well that the governor of Pennsylvania promised to set him up in business for himself if young Franklin would just go to London to buy fonts and printing equipment. Franklin did go to London, but the governor reneged on his promise and Benjamin was forced to spend several months in England doing print work.

Benjamin had been living with the Read family before he left for London. Deborah Read, the very same girl who had seen young Benjamin arrive in Philadelphia, started talking marriage, with the young printer. But Ben did not think he was ready. While he was gone, she married another man.

Upon returning to Philadelphia, Franklin tried his hand at helping to run a shop, but soon went back to being a printer's helper. Franklin was a better printer than the man he was working for, so
